Label: 1 mm class
dryMass: Values beyond column H are ignored and can be used for notes.

Label: 2 mm class
dryMass: Not every prey type has to represent a size class. You can use multiple rows for taxa of the same size with different regression parameters, for example.

Label: 3 mm class
dryMass: The 'a' and 'b' values in columns E and F are for the body length-dry mass regression W = a L^b, with L in mm and W in mg

Label: 4 mm class
dryMass: When they are left blank, default parameters for 'All Insects' from Benke et al 1999 are used.

Label: 5 mm class
dryMass: Energy density is given in calories per gram dry weight. When it is left blank, a default of 5200 is used (Rosenfeld and Taylor 2009).

Label: 6 mm class
dryMass: In this example, we have separate prey types for Chironomid larvae in the two smallest size classes versus other taxa.

Label: 7 mm class
dryMass: Drift density is the number of drifting prey items in that category per cubic meter of water

Label: 8 mm class
dryMass: The 'label' can be whatever you want
